reviews.review: Absolutely outstanding movie! Daniel Craig was wonderful funny clever and very handsome! The whole film I was at the edge of my seat but also laughing!!! Its a must see!
Very well done!  Go see it!!!!

really funny, lots of twists didn't expect.
great casting!
Very well written!  Keeps your attention the entire time!  Loved it!
Clever and funny.  The characters were well developed - although would like to have seen/heard more from LaKeith!

Movie Review:
Knives Out is one of those genre mixing movies that can either fall flat or they can be really great. This one that attempts to mix mystery with comedy lands somewhere in the middle. Not a classic but entertaining enough to keep one's attention. 
This plot feels like the Twilight Zone episode with the family and the masks. Christopher Plummer plays the grandfather who built an empire and his family are taking too much advantage in one way or another.  
The plot is a reasonable whodunnit but as I stated the comedy/mystery ratio isn't quite right. Just when you are engrossed in the puzzle something happens to make you laugh. 
This movie does boast a formidable cast. Jamie Lee Curtis plays the eldest daughter, who by being the eldest feels she controls all and seemingly is the only one to have a genuine relationship with her father. Daniel Craig plays the detective with the ridiculous choice of a southern accent. I'm not sure if this was a nod to Hercule Poirot but the accent doesn't work and is rightfully mocked throughout the movie. His whole character to me feels out of place. 
 I also enjoyed Toni Collette's portrayal of a woman who invented a ludicrous term for skin care. 
Where this movie really succeeds is the family interaction. The moments that seemed the most realistic shined through. Curtis's breakdown over loss. Plummer's friendship with his caretaker. And of course the family arguments were the most juicy bits!
One of the funniest movies I have seen.
Absolutely hilarious!! Daniel Craig and Toni Collette are both hilarious!!
Amazing cast & kept me hooked the entire time.
